author: A_Brickset_user
title: Good
review: I like the road plates from 1997, and it's a shame they are not available any more. I was lucky to buy another copy in the local store today, so now I got two copies! These plates can expand a town very fast, and I am going to buy many curves, straights and T-crosses if I can find them anywhere. Lego Company, why don't you rerelease these good road plates together with the two older types? If you can find this in a store, go and buy it!

author: Blade
title: Expand Your World
review:
Just went digging and found these. They came in a set of 2 per pack. I only ever got these 2 when they were discontinued. As a small child these were very expensive for just 2 boards and my parents didn't see the point.

Now a days i would recommend risking your life to get them as they are very scarce now and help in both the play and display areas of LEGO. Maybe they will re-release these again and I for 1 will be stocking up.

author: asianlego
title: Too Little Space
review:
I loved roadplates as they expand my city but cross road plates are useless for people like me who like vendors and lots of walking space on either side of the tarmac. There is very little space unlike the Curve Road Plates or the T-Junction Road Plates. Either way, I am sure that a cross road is vital in every town so I keep the score at 3.

-asianlego
